name: Statistics for Life & Social Scientists
description: The course discusses many advanced statistical methods used in the life and social sciences. Emphasis is on learning how to become a critical interpreter of these methodologies while keeping mathematical requirements low. Topics covered include multiple regression, logistic regression, discriminant and cluster analysis, principal components and factor analysis.
exclusions: All C-level/300-level and D-level/400-level STA courses or equivalents except STAC32H3, STAC50H3 and STA322H.
